div.p: Chef is an open-source systems integration framework built specifically for automating the cloud. No matter how complex the realities of your business, Chef makes it easy to deploy servers and scale applications throughout your entire infrastructure. Because it combines the fundamental elements of configuration management and service oriented architectures with the full power of Ruby, Chef makes it easy to create an elegant, fully automated infrastructure.

Chef allows you to create perfect clones of QA environments, pre-production environments, partner preview environments and more. Once automated, you hold a blueprint for your infrastructure, enabling you to build, or rebuild, automatically in minutes or hours – not weeks or months. Better still, when you take those environments live and reality intrudes - which, trust us, it will - Chef gives you endless flexibility to adapt on the fly. We all know business is "a series of managed disasters." Chef gives you the power to deal with them quickly, accurately and intelligently.
More information can be found at Chef Home.

The plugin interacts with the Chef's shell trough the commander agent, the Chef utility allows you to perform different actions getting the same results that you would get from the command line. This plugin offers five main functions, Cookbooks can be downloaded from the Opscode repository to the local node, Cookbooks can be downloaded and installed on the local node from the Opscode repository (Git is required for this action), Cookbooks can be uploaded from the local node to the Chef server, Recipes can be added to a node run-list and finally the configuration defined on a node run-list can be applied to a node.

Electric Commander itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes, combo buttons, historical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of he log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested against Chef version 10.12.0
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
Download a specific cookbook from the Opscode repository.
- Command to be executed: <Knife Path> cookbook site download <Cookbook Name> <Options>.

tr.td: Knife Path
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Configuration File
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Chef Server URL
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Cookbook Name
Provide the name of the cookbook to download. (Required)
Cookbook Version
Provide the specific version to download. If left blank the latest version will be downloaded.
Force
If checked forces the download of a deprecated cookbook.
Verbose
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
File Name
Provide the file name to write to. The extension of this file name will be tar.gz. If not provided the default cookbook name will be used.
Download To
Provide the path where to download the cookbook, if no path is provided the cookbook will downloaded to the current workspace.

div.p: Install a specific cookbook on a Chef client.
- Command to be executed: <Knife Path> cookbook site download <Cookbook Name> <Options>.

tr.td: Knife Path
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Configuration File
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Chef Server URL
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Cookbook Name
Provide the name of the cookbook to download. (Required)
Cookbook Version
Provide the specific version to download. If left blank the latest version will be downloaded.
No Dependencies
If checked cookbooks dependencies will not be installed automatically.
Verbose
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
Cookbooks Path
Provide the path where to install the cookbook. is suggested to use the path where all cookbooks are stored e.g /etc/chef/cookbooks (This is the default value).
Branch To Work With
Provide the default branch to work with [ defaults to master ].

div.p: Upload one or more cookbooks from your local cookbook repository(ies) to the Chef Server. Only files that don't yet exist on the server will be uploaded.
- Command to be executed: <Knife Path> cookbook upload <Cookbooks> <Options>.

tr.td: Knife Path
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Configuration File
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Chef Server URL
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Cookbook Names
Provide the name of the cookbook(s) to upload, separate them by a space. (Required)
All Cookbooks
If checked all cookbooks will be uploaded.
Cookbooks Paths
Provide a colon-separated path to look for cookbooks in e.g /etc/chef/cookbooks/:/etc/chef/more_cookbooks.
Include Dependencies
If checked indicates that when a cookbook has a dependency on one or more other cookbooks, those cookbooks will also be uploaded.
Verbose
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
Additional Commands
Provide any additional commands if needed.

div.p: Add recipes and roles to a node run-list.
- Command to be executed: <Knife Path> node run_list add <Node Name> <Run List Items> <Options>.

tr.td: Knife Path
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Configuration File
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Chef Server URL
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Node Name
Provide the name of the Node to add the recipes to. (Required)
Run List Items

Provide the run list items to add to the node run-list. Remember that you need to put the items in quotes when roles are been added, roles are been added combined with recipes, the recipe full qualified format is been used or the cookbook recipe format is been used.
Verbose
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
After Item
Provide the item to use as a reference to place the new entries after in the node run-list e.g recipe[my_recipe].

div.p: Run the chef-client command on a specific Node.

tr.td: Chef-client Path
Provide the path to the chef-client executable e.g /usr/bin/chef-client (This is the default value). (Required)
Configuration File
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /etc/chef/client.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Node Name
Provide the name of the node.
Replace Current Run List
Provide a new run list items to place instead of the current run list.
JSON Attributes Definition
Provide the JSON file or URL to load attributes from.
Daemonize
If checked the process will be daemonized.
Interval(seconds)
Provide a interval in seconds for the chef-client to periodically run.
Log Level
Choose the log level, available options are: Debug, Information, Warning, Error and Fatal.
Additional Commands
Provide any additional commands if needed.
